Commentary.ab: Y12.9a auuaŋᵛhūš] Kellens. Mss. 4000, 4045 with ŋᵛh. Lectio diffcilior. Geldner auuaŋhūš; Bartholomae auuaŋ́hīš; Hoffmann and Forssman auuaŋhūīš.
Y12.9a akō.dā̊bīš] sec. most of the mss.; Kellens, Geldner akō.dābīš. Tremblay, 2006 p. 254 akō.dā̊bīš "parallélisme morphologique avec vaŋhu.dāh-".

Y12.9c ātarāiš] Bartholomae from ātar- with thematization, from verb tar- "approach, attack" (in a daevic form). Kellens, 2007, p. 135 translates as "de l'autre camp" (= "of the other side") from ātara- without needing a thematization. This interpretation is tempting.
Y12.9d yaϑanā] Kellens, 2007, p. 135 "de *yat-na- «mise en place rituelle»", hence expected *yaϑənā. Mss. regularly yaϑanā (except 15, 60 yaϑənā).
Y12.9d rąxšiiaṇtā] Kellens (Bartholomae, vid. Kellens, 1984 , p. 160 ff.), cod. (vid. Apparatus); Geldner rąxšaiiaṇta.

Parallels.ab: vī daēuuāiš ... sarəm mruiiē ~ Y12.11 zaraϑuštrō daēuuāiš sarəm viiāmruuītā; ~ Y12.11 daēuuāiš sarəm vīmruiiē; ~ Y12.11 anāiš viiāmruuītā.
